subtitle: This is a really tasty and versatile recipe you could serve as brunch, lunch or supper. You could vary the cheese to what you have available.

method.text: Preheat grill to a medium heat.
Wash the spinach thoroughly. Drain. Place in a saucepan. Add seasoning and nutmeg. Cook gently for 3-5 min until wilted, stirring to ensure even cooking.

Melt half the butter. Stir in the flour and garlic salt and cook for 1 min. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in the milk. Bring to the boil and cook for 1-2 min until thickened. Stir in half the cheese and set aside.
Half fill a frying pan with water and bring to the boil. Place egg poaching rings in the pan. Reduce the heat to a simmer and break the egg into them. Season and cover the pan.
Simmer for 3-4 min until eggs are set. Carefully remove the eggs from the pan and rings. Drain the spinach thoroughly. Roughly chop and stir in the remaining butter. Add the sauce and ham.
Arrange the spinach mixture between individual oval ovenproof dishes. Make a well for each for the poached eggs. Arrange the eggs in the dish. Sprinkle over the remaining cheese and breadcrumbs.
Grill for 3-5 min until cheese has melted and breadcrumbs are brown and crispy. Serve immediately.

title: Baked egg, Stilton and ham
